title: Instant Pot Corned Beef Recipe
description: Instant Pot corned beef with all the fixings is ready in just 2 hours with an electric pressure cooker. Guaranteed juicy, tender corned beef every time.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Beef Corned Beef Recipes Instant Pot Corned Beef 4.8 (229) 193 Reviews 26 Photos This Instant Pot corned beef recipe is easy to prep and ready in just two hours. The beef brisket is cooked with beer and garlic in an electric pressure cooker to guarantee juicy, tender corned beef every time. If you want to complete the feast, you can cook baby carrots, quartered potatoes, and cabbage wedges in the bottom of the Instant Pot while the corned beef is resting. By Nicole Russell Nicole Russell Nicole Russell is a prolific contributor to Allrecipes and an avid member of the Allrecipes Allstars. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on February 14, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 26 26 26 26 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Additional Time: 25 mins Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe You can make tender, juicy, and super flavorful corned beef in just 2 hours with 4 ingredients and your trusty multi-functional pressure cooker. Don't believe us? Just try this top-rated Instant Pot corned beef recipe. Instant Pot Corned Beef Ingredients You need just four ingredients to make this top-rated recipe for corned beef in the Instant Pot: WaterTwo cups of water (plus a 12-ounce beer) should be enough liquid to cook a 3-pound corned beef brisket. BeerOpt for a dark Irish stout, such as Guinness, for the richest flavor. If you'd prefer not to use alcohol in this recipe, try substituting with beef broth or apple cider (or a mixture of both). GarlicAmp up the flavor of this corned beef recipe with four cloves of garlic. You can use more or less, depending on your flavor preferences. Corned Beef BrisketOf course, you'll need corned beef. This recipe calls for a brisket that weighs about three pounds. The brisket should come with a spice packet. What Is Corned Beef? How to Make Corned Beef In the Instant Pot You'll find the full recipe below, but here's what you can expect when you make this Instant Pot corned beef recipe: Combine Ingredients Add water, beer, and garlic to the Instant Pot or other multi-functional pressure cooker. Place the trivet inside, then place the brisket on top of the trivet. Season the meat with the spice packet. Set and Cook Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure and let cook for 90 minutes, allowing 10-15 minutes for the pressure to build. Release and Rest Release the pressure using the quick-release method (this should take about 5 minutes). Remove the lid. Transfer the brisket to a baking sheet, cover with aluminum foil, and allow the meat to rest for about 15 minutes before serving. How to Make Corned Beef and Cabbage In the Instant Pot What if you'd like to make a full corned beef and cabbage meal in your Instant Pot? Here's a tip from recipe creator and Allrecipes Allstar Soup Loving Nicole: "Remove the trivet while your brisket is resting and place baby carrots, quartered red potatoes, and cabbage wedges in the bottom of the Instant Pot. Secure the lid, lock, seal, and select the manual setting. Set for 5 minutes. Do a quick release. The rested brisket and vegetables are ready at the same time." How Long to Cook Corned Beef In the Instant Pot With your Instant Pot set to high pressure, the corned beef brisket should be fully cooked within 90 minutes. However, every brisket is different. If you're unsure, reviewers suggest cooking your brisket on high pressure for about 20 minutes per pound. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Wow," raves Xan Y. "This was by far, one of the BEST corned beef recipes we have ever had. I used beef stock instead of water and beer for the liquids, and it came out so flavorful and juicy. I will never cook this any other way!" "I used four cups of beef stock in the pot with meat and it came out tender and super flavorful," says Fanny Araa. "While the brisket was resting, I tossed baby potatoes and carrots in the broth and cooked those for 15 min. PERFECTION!" "This was delicious," according to Linda Van Wickler. "The whole family gave it rave reviews. I followed a suggestion of cooking cabbage and potatoes and carrots while the meat rested. Perfect accompaniment." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 cups water 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 (3 pound) corned beef brisket with spice packet Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine water, beer, and garlic in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place trivet inside. Place brisket on the trivet and sprinkle spice packet on top. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 90 minutes. Allow 10 minutes for pressure to build. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Transfer brisket to a baking sheet, cover with aluminum foil, and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 349 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Corned Beef 01 of 26 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 26 Photo by  FizzyBeer3572 03/26/2024 I used the corned beef from Costco (Bill Bailey’s) 3lbs ….with Guinness Extra Stout. It turned out perfect!! 03 of 26 Photo by  IndigoHam1064 03/18/2023 I followed the corned beef recipe as written. The brisket I had was a tad bit smaller than called for, but I cooked it as directed and it turned out great. I opted to oven roast carrots and baby potatoes with a small onion. We enjoyed the beef and vegetables with brown bread and a wee bit o' coleslaw. Delish! 04 of 26 Photo by  HappyChive1862 01/28/2023 Yowza, what a delicious dinner! My butcher sells the brisket pre seasoned, so mine didn’t have any spice packet with it. I used a bottle of 5-year old gluten-free beer that I found in the back of the fridge (good use for it), and I added a tbsp of Better Than Bouillon to the water. Otherwise I followed the instructions in the recipe exactly. My brisket was smaller than 3 lbs, so I shortened the cooking time, and the meat is definitely “al dente”. But I kinda like to chew on my meat and enjoy the juices, so I don’t mind that. Next time though, I’ll make the cooking time longer.Otherwise, a successful recipe I think. It’s added to my collection. 05 of 26 Photo by  Matt Schwarzman 03/21/2022 Loved it! It came out very tender and delicious. I am not much of a cabbage lover so I just added carrots and baby reds as suggested. 06 of 26 Photo by  Jim 03/18/2022 I made this tonite and it was delicious! Even my picky eater liked it. I prefer recipe sites that include comments because I often pick up a hint or two from them. I added a little smear of dijon mustard on top before putting on the spice packet. I added a quartered onion. I did not use beer as I don't like it. I used 2 cups of water with a spoon full of beef bouillon concentrate. I also added a bit of Maggi Amore. I had a 3.3 pound point cut of corned beef. I cooked it just as directed in the recipe for 90 minutes. I let it do a natural release for 15 minutes and then quick release for the rest. I set it aside for 15 minutes before serving. It was incredibly tender and flavorful. I can't understand why some people had issues with it being dry? Instead of the customary potatoes I served it with cheese filled perogies. They were a nice combination. Thank you for posting such an EZ and flavorful recipe. 07 of 26 Photo by  Carebear1982 03/15/2022 Followed to a T. Bottle of beer, two cups water, couple tsps of minced garlic. Trivet with about a 4lb corned beef on top, sprinkled with the season packet. I did 95 min because mine was a little bigger then the recipe. Sliced against the grain. It was mouthwatering tender and delicious. I did colcannon potatoes on the side and cooked carrots separate, then stirrered into the meat juice left in the pot for a few minutes. All was delicious. 08 of 26 Photo by  fatalsongbird 01/01/2022 09 of 26 Photo by  Darlene Swiderski 06/01/2020 this was very helpful as new to instant pot, was tender and delicious, will make again 10 of 26 Photo by  Jennifer Partaka 04/20/2020 This is the second time I have made this dish. I use a dark stout beer and it adds so much flavor. Comes out fork tender each time! 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Instant Pot Guinness Corned Beef 32 Ratings Braised Corned Beef Brisket 1,057 Ratings Sous Vide Corned Beef 4 Ratings Slow-Cooker Corned Beef and Cabbage 2,068 Ratings Slow Cooker Guinness Corned Beef and Veggies 172 Ratings Corned Beef Irish Feast 19 Ratings Easy Corned Beef and Cabbage 213 Ratings Corned Beef and Cabbage 1,424 Ratings Instant Pot Shepherd's Pie 58 Ratings Pressure Cooker Corned Beef 48 Ratings Instant Pot® Irish Beef Stew Sarah's Slow-Cooker Corned Beef and Cabbage 24 Ratings St. Patrick's Day Casserole 8 Ratings Apple and Brown Sugar Corned Beef 208 Ratings Dutch Oven Corned Beef and Cabbage 259 Ratings Corned Beef for Sandwiches in a Slow Cooker 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Nicole Russell
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Combine water, beer, and garlic in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Place trivet inside. Place brisket on the trivet and sprinkle spice packet on top. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 90 minutes. Allow 10 minutes for pressure to build. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Transfer brisket to a baking sheet, cover with aluminum foil, and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
